title: Weathervanes Of Fodlan
opening: Annette and Gilbert hope to acquire the Hero's Relic of House Dominic from Annette's uncle, Baron Dominic.

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: Professor, do you have a moment?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: I would hear your opinion on our situation. Given our current fighting power, what sort of challenge do you expect we pose to the Empire? Do we have any hope of victory?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Our preparations are lacking.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: The probability of victory is low.

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: So, we agree. However, in order to strengthen our forces, we--

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: Aaaargh! Ugh, why would anyone put a barrel here?!

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: Ow, that really smarts... Oh. Hello, Father.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Father?

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: ... Another stupendous fall.

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: As though you care about my well-being. Anyway... Professor, I'm heading out for a bit.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Where are you going?

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: I was thinking of going to visit my uncle.

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: To see my brother? Why is that, Annette?

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: I wanna ask him to entrust me with the Hero's Relic of House Dominic. The fight from here on out is gonna be tough. I need to do whatever I can to get stronger. The best thing we can do, as far as I can tell, is to have another Hero's Relic at our disposal.

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: You are not wrong, yet it will not be easy.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Why's that?

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: Under pressure from Cornelia, House Dominic is maintaining a pro-Imperial stance. That makes us his enemy. Brother or no, he will not hand over a Hero's Relic to us.

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: But he's not a bad person... And we'll never know unless we ask, right? And Mother might be there too...

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: The Dominic region is, at present, enemy territory. There is no guarantee you can see them safely.

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: Fine. Be that way. It's not like I was planning to ask for your help, anyway. Professor, don't worry about me. I'll be back soon, and with a Relic, no less!

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: Annette! Wait! She never listens. So frustrating. However, if she were able to retrieve the Hero's Relic, it would prove a great boon to our forces. Perhaps I should prepare myself for the worst. I shall travel with Annette to see my brother. Professor, might I ask you to take on a task for me? It is entirely possible that we shall be captured in the Dominic region. In anticipation of that... I would ask that you wait outside the region, with an army at your command.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: I cannot say with confidence that we will be able to bring back the Hero's Relic without issue. While it pains me to ask this favor of you, I must also thank you for accepting.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I need some time...

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: I should be able to slow Annette's departure for a short while, at the least. Please join us when you can.

battle.speaker: Annette
battle.line: Uncle, I beg you! Please give me the Hero's Relic!

battle.speaker: Baron Dominic
battle.line: Even in this land, the Empire's eye shines bright. To hand over such a weapon to you, our enemy, is unthinkable...

battle.speaker: Gilbert
battle.line: We are well aware. Brother, I beg you. For the sake of the Kingdom's revival...

battle.speaker: Baron Dominic
battle.line: I cannot. If it becomes known that I gave you aid, my lands will be annexed in a bitter instant.

battle.speaker: Gilbert
battle.line: Then we must relent. Annette, there is nothing for us here. We should go.

battle.speaker: Baron Dominic
battle.line: No. Letting you simply leave will invite accusations of collusion. I must take you as my hostages.

battle.speaker: Gilbert
battle.line: So... It has come to pass after all.

battle.speaker: Baron Dominic
battle.line: Annette, live here with me. You needn't return to that helpless band of rebels without a glimmer of hope for victory.

battle.speaker: Annette
battle.line: You're wrong! That will never happen, Uncle!

battle.speaker: Baron Dominic
battle.line: Your mother is also here in this land. Do not dismiss my proposition so readily...

battle.speaker: Annette
battle.line: We can't afford to stay here. Father, we have to run!

battle.speaker: Gilbert
battle.line: Be calm, Annette. I assumed something like this would happen. If we do not come back, the professor will come to get us. We need but wait and keep faith...

battle.speaker: Kingdom Soldier
battle.line: Our allies are being held in that stronghold in the southeast! Please, rescue them quickly!

battle.speaker: Baron Dominic
battle.line: Ha! Right to the last, you hope to strike me down. In that case, I will also lay my cards on the table and commit all my resources to this fight!

battle.speaker: Gilbert
battle.line: Reinforcements?! That will make life more difficult.

battle.speaker: Annette
battle.line: Oh, thank goodness! Let's run, Father!

battle.speaker: Gilbert
battle.line: Annette, go. I will acquire the Hero's Relic, even if it means crossing blades with my brother.

battle.speaker: Annette
battle.line: I couldn't possibly leave you to do it alone! Father, please let me go with you!

battle.speaker: Baron Dominic
battle.line: Even if you must do it by force, bring me Annette!

character-falls.speaker: Baron Dominic
character-falls.line: It's for your own good. You must understand, Annette.

character-falls.speaker: Gilbert
character-falls.line: I am soldier enough to admit I have lost this battle. Brother, I will lay down arms...

boss.speaker: Baron Dominic
boss.line: I have my own reason for not giving up. And the less I speak of it, the better...

boss.speaker: Gilbert
boss.line: My brother, I beg you...the Relic!

boss.speaker: Baron Dominic
boss.line: I do not wish to repeat myself! If you want it that badly, slay me and claim it for your own

boss.speaker: Baron Dominic
boss.line: I have no wish to enact violence on you, Annette. Listen to me and do as I say.

boss.speaker: Annette
boss.line: I will not listen! I can't and I won't! There is somewhere I must return to!

end.speaker: Baron Dominic
end.line: So...this is it. I fought well, in the end. I doubt Cornelia will think I cooperated with you. Take the Hero's Relic and go. And in return...promise to restore the Kingdom.

end.speaker: Baron Dominic
end.line: And don't worry about your wife. Whatever happens, I swear I will protect her. When all of this is over, you had better return to her. Make sure victory is yours...Gustave.

end.speaker: Gilbert
end.line: I cannot tell you how grateful we are for your assistance.

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: I don't know what would have happened if not for you... And thanks to you, I got this!

end.speaker: Gilbert
end.line: The Magic hammer, Crusher... The Hero's Relic of House Dominic. My brother would not surrender such a Relic without a fight... I hope you understand.

end.speaker: Gilbert
end.line: House Dominic is one of the ten great bloodlines. Yet within the Kingdom, we are mere feudal lords. With the Empire growing in strength, Dominic must kneel. To do otherwise would be suicide. The western lords, and other rulers, are in the same situation. They all comply, albeit reluctantly. If we defeat the Empire, I hope the Kingdom will rise once more, under the banner of a legitimate king.

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: I hope so too. That's why we can't give up!

end.speaker: Gilbert
end.line: To that end, Professor, we will require your help. I hope we can continue depending on you.

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: Don't worry! We won't make you do all the hard work by yourself. I'll give it my all too! Speaking of... I'm gonna get straight to training!

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: Gaaaaaah! Why would someone put a dumb wooden box here?!

end.speaker: Gilbert
end.line: And please, look after my daughter as well.
